post.desc:
For context, it is theorized that Chimata is Kamu≈çichihime, who would also be another sister along with the well-known Konohanasakuyahime and Iwanagahime. ü§î Though do keep in mind that the line is really thin, with most of the foundation being just the fact that Chimata is an ichigami.

A "market god" is not something exclusive to Kamu≈çichihime. There are a lot of kamis who are also ichigami ‚Äì famous names like Daikoku-sama revered by the Earth Rabbits, Ebisu, Inari, Jiz≈ç... Despite that, however, I still hold my candle for the theory. I do love the prospect that **both of Sakuya's older sisters have revealed themselves in Gens≈çky≈ç.**

Another thing would be the [**Hare and Ke.**](https://kuon.tokyo/blogs/blog/hare-and-ke) Fan translations seem to have gone with Chimata being a "god of revelry", which I personally think it's a bit off. Hare and Ke are specific concepts in Japanese ‚Äì the special and the mundane. Hence, I believe transliterating it like Yin and Yang would be more appropriate.
